intro: Rajania ovata var. ehrenbergii, commonly known as the Ehrenberg's starfish flower, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with a distinctive central disc. The plant has a compact, bushy growth habit and possesses lance-shaped leaves with a waxy texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological needs, it is considered a conservation concern in its native habitat.
